fixes.name: Median Sales Price National
fixes.solution_explanation: Converted Tableau MEDIAN([Price]) to DAX MEDIAN over 'trulia_dataset_cleaned (trulia_dataset_cleanedTBL)'[Price]. This is an aggregation and therefore implemented as a measure.
fixes.type_changed_reason: This calculation uses an aggregation (MEDIAN), so it must be created as a measure.

fixes.name: Median Sales Price % Increase
fixes.dax_expression:
VAR MedPrice = MEDIAN('trulia_dataset_cleaned (trulia_dataset_cleanedTBL)'[Price])
VAR MedLast = MEDIAN('trulia_dataset_cleaned (trulia_dataset_cleanedTBL)'[Last Sold For])
RETURN ((MedPrice - MedLast) / MedLast) * 100
fixes.solution_explanation: Translated the Tableau expression by converting each MEDIAN(...) to DAX MEDIAN and computing the percent increase. The calculation uses aggregations and is therefore a measure.
fixes.type_changed_reason: This calculation uses aggregations (MEDIAN), so it must be created as a measure.

fixes.name: County Drill Down
fixes.solution_explanation: Converted Tableau IF [State Set] THEN [COUNTYNAME] END to DAX IF(condition, value). This is row-level logic operating on fields from the same row, so it should be a calculated column.
fixes.type_changed_reason: This calculation applies row-level logic (evaluates a condition per row and returns COUNTYNAME), therefore it should be a calculated column.
